titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records,Audiovisual materials, Series 39
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Audiovisual materials, Series 39 FA756

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-02-06 00:01:30 -0500.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Audiovisual materials, Series 39

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The contents of this series has been separated from other archival holdings. As such, the description of any individual item, or set of items, may also currently appear, in some form, in the finding aid for the originating collection.
Future processing, description, and presentation of films will seek to address this issue as much as feasible.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted from access at the discretion of RAC.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audio and video pertaining to NAR's gubernatorial and political career.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in subseries by media type (film, video) and chronologically by creation date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage from campaigns, conventions, and official events that are specifically related to political activities in the life of NAR. Many dozens of campaign commercials, including TV and radio spots.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Many dozens of campaign commercials, including TV and radio spots, are included in the NAR collection but have recieved only basic processing. â€“ see Special Formats staff for more information.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller Shots from Fox News

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A newsreel compilation from 1958 of Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial footage. Includes footage of Nelson A. Rockefeller in New York City at a reception for his gubernatorial campaign, Dwight D. Eisenhower arriving in New York City, Nelson A. Rockefeller and Dwight D. Eisenhower in 5th Avenue parade, John D. Rockefeller 3rd with Senator Keating, construction of the Interfaith Center, Nelson A. Rockefeller family portrait, President Eisenhower with Nelson Rockefeller, Nelson A. Rockefeller and David Kennedy, Nelson A. Rockefeller campaiging in Glen Falls, New York. Nelson A. Rockefeller and wife visiting Venezuela. Nelson A. Rockefeller in Albany, New York at swearing in ceremony and celeration. Mrs. Nelson A. Rockefeller and Nelson sewing union labels on clothing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In his annual message to the legislature, Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller recommends solutions to the problems facing the people of New York State. These include: issues of education on all levels, water pollution abatement, per capita aid, traffic safety, and full crew law. The Governor also relates how state laws are made.

accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New York State Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller reports in detail about the New York State annual budget. Several key figures speak about their requested funding including: Dr. William J. Ronan from the Tri-State Transportation Committee, Lawrence W. Pierce from the Division of Youth, J. Burch McMorran, Supt. of Public Works, George K. Wyman, Commissioner of Social Welfare, John Hathorn from the Office of Indian Affairs, Dr. James E. Allen, Commissioner of Education, and Dr. Henry Brill, Director of Pilgrim State Hospital. Captain John C. Miller of the Oneida Barracks N.Y. State Police requests a $150 increase for dog food.
